website_summaries.verdict: Due to the miniscule size of its pieces, and detail of each Pokémon, constructing a Nanoblock set will take time, even for veteran LEGO builders.
pros: Will take a while to fully assemble
Small, yet detailed pixelated Pokémon model
Many other Pokémon available, including Pichu, Snorlax, and Totodile
cons: Some may not appreciate the extra-tiny pieces

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I definitely recommend this to anyone that loves Pokémon. Even if you don’t, it’s very entertaining to put these together! I am obsessed with nanoblocks. This is a legit product from the actual Japanese nanablock company. I am so happy with my purchase. If you build it correctly there should be no balance issues whatsoever! If people are saying it’s unbalanced, it’s 100% not due to the product but the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mai

customer_reviews.title: Love Pikachu!
customer_reviews.text: I just had to get myself one of these since I just love Pikachu. :) I had no problem building this little Pikachu. The dimensions listed on Amazon is the size of the package, but the actual size of this figure is no more than about 2-ish inches tall. Apparently there were also extra pieces included and instruction were understandable. Definitely wouldn't recommend giving this to someone under the age of 13 to build. This also isn't a toy because the pieces will come off if you handle it roughly, (cough-cough KIDS).
customer_reviews.author: HuneeLemon

customer_reviews.title: Very time consuming, but thats the point...its a challenge..
customer_reviews.text: Despite coming from the far East, the item arrived rather quickly. This was a gift for my son, due to his love of Pokemon as well as different types of puzzles and puzzle-related items. You will almost always have extra pieces for some reason, which drives my son nuts (its so funny, lol). But, once its finished he is so proud of himself and those microscopic pieces (and THEY ARE, lol) come together and really makes the character come to life. Great gift, but make sure the intended recipient has patience...and a pair of tweezers.
customer_reviews.author: DARTH PEEL

customer_reviews.title: The official nanoblock
customer_reviews.text: These are the official pokemon nanoblocks made by Kawada. These are the ones they sell at the Pokemon Centers in Japan. They are not the Loz ones. It was pretty simple to build, but out of some of the othe Pokemon Nanoblocks I have put together, Pikachu was the most fragile, especially with the ears and tail. For people who have never used nanoblocks before - they are really small (think of the flat Lego blocks and shrink them down a bit). The instructions can sometimes be confusing, but with a little time and patience, you can build an awesome Pikachu.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi

customer_reviews.title: Not nanoblocks and INCRDIBLY SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Very very very very small. My daughter loves legos and Pokémon... she will build sets for hours. But this was much smaller pieces than expected. She opened it and didn’t even attempt it :( hoping we can do it to set out as decor in her Pokémon room
customer_reviews.author: Cara Harrison

customer_reviews.title: so fragile, so precious
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t put my charmander together yet, but we did put together a venusaur one and it was harder than you’d think! I think it’s because of how small the pieces are.. either way, this was a perfect little project for me and my boyfriend. Next we’re thinking about building ikea furniture together, because if we can put these together that will be a cakewalk. hahaha. no, but really.. it’s hard. don’t drop it. you WILL die inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: It’s Nanoblocks!
customer_reviews.text: I own several Pokémon Nanoblocks. Mewtwo is my newest and one of my favorites. He is cute and was assembled quickly. If you haven’t used Nanoblocks before the blocks are VERY small, and are not suitable for young kids. I personally like to super glue Nanoblocks because they do fall apart easily, and I don’t want to disassemble them anyway. I really love the purple colored blocks, they are very vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are the official pokemon nanoblocks made by Kawada. These are the ones they sell at the Pokemon Centers in Japan. They are not the Loz ones. The Venasaur Nanoblock is personally my favorite out of some of the other Pokemon Nanoblocks I have put together. It has really nice colors that are fun to look at. For people who have never used nanoblocks before - they are really small (think of the flat Lego blocks and shrink them down a bit). The instructions can sometimes be confusing, but with a little time and patience, you can build an awesome Venasaur.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Pokémon lovers
customer_reviews.text: Each year I buy my bf one of these! So far he has yo ahí, charizard, snoopy and now eevee! It’s very cute and delicate, the pieces are very small so watch out for kids. It does come with extra pieces in case you need replacements and it also comes with instructions on how to assemble. Mine did come in the pictured packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic item! 4 stars only because instructions could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I love Nanoblocks. The only thing I would change is the instruction. They’re not quite as obvious as ones supplied with LEGO, so there are occasions where I find I’ve made a mistake and have to tear down to correct. These are a great gift for older kids and adults with patience. Not recommended for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome puzzle!
customer_reviews.text: Best puzzle I've ever come across. As an avid Lego fan and lover of a challenge this was perfect for me. The instructions were not in English but the pictures were very clear. It was a great challenge and I absolutely loved putting it together. They are very small pieces so keep puppies and children away from it or you might lose a piece or two.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Too cute!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a present for my son's upcoming birthday. I did receive and earlier than the tracking indicated. I was getting concerned and when I reached out to the seller they reminded me that items going though customs tend to take a little longer, and they were able to give a better idea of where it is. Great product and great service!!! The item itself self looks like it will be so much fun to put together, I simply can not wait for my son to see this on his birthday!
customer_reviews.author: SnickerDoodle

customer_reviews.title: Be mindful who you buy this for.
customer_reviews.text: Legit product came in. These are very fun. Would recommend for teens or young adults. Definitely not easy. Parents, if you want to get this for your little ones, be mindful that they will need help and the parts are tiny. As for me, my 2 year old enjoys watching his papa struggle LMAO wouldn't be worth it if it was easy to build :)
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Borquez

customer_reviews.title: Unless you like torture, please don't buy
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted a very specific pokemon lego toy, obviously, so we were happy to find the one he wanted on amazon. That's when things took a turn for the worse. These building blocks are small, as referenced by "nano" in the name but the instructions were incomprehensible. The only reason this gets two stars from me and not one is because my on loves it - even though it has already started to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: NAWMama

customer_reviews.title: Gyarados Comes apart too easy!
customer_reviews.text: He's WAY cute assembled, but he's extremely delicate. I do realize these are not the type of builds to be played with, but pieces of him broke off when I was just moving him to a new shelf. The look is great, but it could be a little more structurally sound in some areas like the tip of the tail.
customer_reviews.author: Katy J

customer_reviews.title: So cute! Perfect for Pokemon & LEGO lovers!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this as a random surprise gift for my fiance who loves Pokemon! It's way smaller than I thought it would be, which is actually awesome! It's so tiny and adorable! Maybe a bit too small for really young kids. Looking to get him more, so we can display them :)
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Small and a bit tedious, but it looks great in the end
customer_reviews.text: This took me around 1.5-2 hours to fully complete. The instructions are a little bit hard to comprehend at the start. I recommend that anyone who gets this and hasn't made any Nanoblock thing before, starts with the flame on the tail. All in all, this is a very fun project if you are willing to waste an hour or so. Also, don't be alarmed if you have extra blocks at the end, they give you a few extras.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Great colors.
customer_reviews.text: These are the official pokemon nanoblocks made by Kawada. These are the ones they sell at the Pokemon Centers in Japan. They are not the Loz ones. The Squirtle Nanoblock was fairly easy to build, although the instructions got confusing at one point. After I put it together, I have it sitting next to Bulbasaur, Charmander, and Pikachu. For people who have never used nanoblocks before - they are really small (think of the flat Lego blocks and shrink them down a bit). The instructions can sometimes be confusing, but with a little time and patience, you can build an awesome Squirtle.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter as a Christmas gift. My daughter loved it very very much and couldn't put it down until it was finished. It did keep her entertained for about maybe 30 minutes forty-five at the tops. She is a very big Pokemon fan.
customer_reviews.author: Unicornhal

customer_reviews.title: Needs an adult/ patient kid to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is not for little kids to assemble. The blocks are so tiny and the directions are a difficult for an adult to understand. Took a while to complete, but my kid was so happy with it! It is great looking (although I sit let him play with it because I don’t want to rebuild! Hahah)
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift, Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is so cute I bought it for a birthaday gift. It's smaller than expected that's why the 4 star rating. The kid loved it though. They are nanoblocks so depending on a child's age they might need help to build it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Cute !
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Pokemon loving husband ! His favourite pokemon is Bulbasor!! It took him several days to build it as the parts are minuscule ! But the end product is this very cute !!!
customer_reviews.author: Mythily

customer_reviews.title: It’s adorable but hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: So it’s really cute and comes out looking like the picture but the directions are complicated and the pieces are tiny! It’s do-able to put together but it’s a struggle. So just be prepared for that, not your normal size LEGO like pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Delia

customer_reviews.title: Great product for an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my niece and it was a hit! The direction were nice and clear. The colors and likeness to the pikachu character were spot on. As expected, the recommended assembly age was a little beyond her skill level so it made for a great snow day project to complete together.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This is so cool.
customer_reviews.text: I got lapras and its a great addition to my Pokemon collection. Its a little hard putting together because the pieces are super small.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These are very disappointing. They say they are for ages 8+. There is no way an 8 year old can put this together without significant adult help... and then that poor adult is likely to go insane from managing these teeny tiny pieces.
customer_reviews.author: CarJar

customer_reviews.title: Micro legos, not easy at all!
customer_reviews.text: In the description I didn't see where (or if it did at all) it said micro legos. The pieces were tiny and VERY HARD to put together. It was for my grandson, he's usually a pro, but this one..returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Zane's

customer_reviews.title: The real deal!
customer_reviews.text: These are the official pokemon nanoblocks made by Kawada. These are the ones they sell at the Pokemon Centers in Japan. They are not the Loz ones. For people who have never used nanoblocks before - they are really small (think of the flat Lego blocks and shrink them down a bit). The instructions can sometimes be confusing, but with a little time and patience, you can build an awesome Bulbasaur.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi

customer_reviews.title: TINY
customer_reviews.text: This thing is TINY. It's like the size of a ping pong ball. I am a fan of the Pokemon franchise and expected this to be bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Although these micro blocks are a tad frustrating do to their size, fantastic instructions. They need to come with a base though like all the other brands do.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Difficult
customer_reviews.text: The pieces are son small that it’s really hard to manipulate the pieces. I worked for 45 min with a 9 year old and couldn’t even get step one done. Maybe by March we will have it together
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Dad and son project
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grandson's 7th birthday in November. My son had to help him put them together, but they had a great time doing it! They like them so much they put them on the Christmas tree.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie D.

customer_reviews.title: Ehh.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter who’s 9 really struggled with this. The directions aren’t great but the product is pretty cute.
customer_reviews.author: Natisadid

customer_reviews.title: Bright colors. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great gift for an older Lego pokemon fan. Hopeful these are just what will make him happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Gen 2 Starter
customer_reviews.text: As a fan of the Pokemon series, this starter makes a fine addition to the collection of other nano blocks products. Going for the menu sprite aesthetic is a great move for this line of products. These blocks take time to get used to working with but the end result of the assembly process is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan ChismarK

customer_reviews.title: Adult will likely need to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The pieces are very small and is difficult for a child to assemble. Final product is very cute, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always loved psyduck! So being able to build him was great! If you love puzzles and want a challenge from all the levels. These tiny nanoblocks are totally worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: Tiny
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is adorable! Since the legos are so tiny my 6year old struggled putting it together. So he selected all the legos for each step and I put it together. He LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Durkn Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for pokémon lovers
customer_reviews.text: Love gifting these to my boyfriend! He has to use tweezers most times to put it together but that doesn’t slow him down much! Super cute too
customer_reviews.author: AFriendlyFireFox

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely terrible. I purchased for my 8 year old Lego builder because he loves Pokemon. The pieces are too small for him to do anything with, and after trying to jump in and help, we realized some of them do not snap into place evenly. I have a disappointed little boy in my house☹️
customer_reviews.author: KLC

customer_reviews.title: This is not even close to Lego!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty small for what you pay for. And it's not at all similar to Lego. I bought it as a gift for my son's friend and ended up feeling a little embarrassed by the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen G

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my significant other and he had a fun time putting it together! He sets it out and displays it proudly!
customer_reviews.author: Bailee Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Good for Pokémon lovers
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my 7 year old nephew who loves Pokémon. Wasn’t very difficult for him to put together and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our son while he was at college. He really liked it. Kept it on his desk. It’s a cute thing and building it was fun
customer_reviews.author: wendy g

customer_reviews.title: Cute but fragile
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and easy to build. Only fault is its extremely fragile once built. Pieces will fall off easily when moved. If gifted it would be best for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No disappointments
customer_reviews.text: 6 year old grandson specifically requested this set. Received it, and it's the genuine Nanoblocks toy. No disappointments.
customer_reviews.author: T.M. Reader

customer_reviews.title: Everything is super tiny
customer_reviews.text: My niece got it. These are very very small compare to LEGO. I did tell her the size of final item but she wanted it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Yakira Blair

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Pocket Monster line
customer_reviews.text: My son purchased this because Totodile is one of his favorite starters. It was easy to put together and looks great. Highly recommend this line.
customer_reviews.author: _NextLvlGaming

customer_reviews.title: Super Tiny but Super Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal Nanoblocks from Kawada that they actually sell at the PokeCenters in Japan and not the ones from Loz. These are so much fun I had to buy a collection of them! I spent a good couple hours building the Pokemon only to be super sad when I finished. Think of them as an alternative LEGO with a blueprint that you have to look at carefully and follow. I would recommend these for any LEGO enthusiest or simply as a gift. I mean who can hate on Pokemon or LEGO-esque stuff?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Impossible
customer_reviews.text: Crap is damn near impossible for anyone older than 13 to put together. I couldn’t even do the base after an hour or two because the blocks are so insanely small. It’s written on there I know but, sheesh man. I wouldn’t recommend this unless your getting for a smart child or someone with extremely small hands and fingers
customer_reviews.author: brandon v.

customer_reviews.title: Fun build.
customer_reviews.text: Gifted. He had a little difficulty assembling it, but he also loves to ask his dad for help.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Valporeon . Happy Grand child
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 year old granddaughter was really pleased. No complaints from here.
customer_reviews.author: Esam

customer_reviews.title: 12 year old pleased with this little surprise
customer_reviews.text: This was a little surprise int the mail for a twelve year old Pokémon lover. Something to occupy after getting in from school. He liked it. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Juju

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this one. Mewtwo is my favorite. I gotta warn you, the set is flimsy after putting it all together. I had to superglue some parts to keep it from falling out. Just remember that they give you spare pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Timmay

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and well appreciated by the 9yo Gengar-fan recipient. Good for the visual-spatial oriented child, not the child who melts down trying to assemble a 60-piece Lego set. I speak from experience.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Legos
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to Legos. Be aware that they are called Nanoblocks for a reason; therefore, they are very, very easy to lose. The instructions are pretty hard to follow, but I recommend going over the paper before attempting to start the build. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: drkndbrn

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: My son put this together in about 25 minutes, but he absolutely loves it & displays it on his Pokemon shelf. It did take a while for shipping, but I was able to get it in time because I took shipping into account. This has extra pieces in case you lose a few. The pieces are TINY, so it's easy to drop and lose them.
customer_reviews.author: Srabee

customer_reviews.title: The one I bought was a genuine package nanoblock. ...
customer_reviews.text: The one I bought was a genuine package nanoblock. I've purchase a few nanoblock packages from the Mega Pokemon Store in Tokyo and the packaging matches. (I would have bought Pikachu in Japan, but they were out). I haven't built it yet so I can't state on the quality of the build. yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sidster2

customer_reviews.title: The sheerness is off the charts!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love these Nanoblock Pokemon, very fun to build and display!
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy from the right seller to avoid problems.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Blastoise Nano Block from a seller by the name of "Close By JP" for $8.93 and it arrived in 3.5 weeks (estimated max 4.5 weeks) and it was an authentic product by Kawada. All the pieces were included plus extra, and the product looks great on my desk. Keep in mind, it is small (2.5 inches tall). I would love if this company had more detailed XL Nano Block Kits that take days to complete. Maybe something for Kawada to consider in a future product line.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Never knew it existed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for a big bulbasaur fan. As of this moment that i type this, that birthday hasn't happened yet so i hope he doesn't accidentally stumble on it and ruin the surprise (fingers crossed!). I never knew these existed, the whole set is amazing and i hope to slowly be able to add them to our collection. It looks amazing and was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Storm Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fun and cute
customer_reviews.text: So cute and fun. I bought a bunch to use as stocking stuffers for my family who are all into Pokémon, including my own stocking ;)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not a good gift for child
customer_reviews.text: Our LEGO loving 6 y.o. Was not able to put these together and his LEGO building dad struggled to put them together. Not a good gift for a child, would be a better adult gift.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Fun to put together
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t have asked for a better tiny LEGO project. So cute. Even comes with extra pieces in case you drop a couple and they get lost forever.
customer_reviews.author: Lexus Watins

customer_reviews.title: Great for any Pokémon fan
customer_reviews.text: My friend loved this toy. It’s fun to build and cute to display.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Tranquilli

customer_reviews.title: Hard to make, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is the pieces are so tiny that sometimes when building it, it’s hard to get them together, but once completed it’s totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Max Major

customer_reviews.title: Be The Child Inside You
customer_reviews.text: Love the nanoblock block companies instructions, they are the easier to read compared to LNO blocks. However this says it was grey and I definitely recieved green, not my biggest worry I wanted to build it but was a bit let down when I opened the blocks and saw it wasn't grey. If anyone is curious about size relation to LNO blocks the finished nanoblock figurines are half the size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend, ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend, who loves puzzles, legos, and Pokemon nostalgia. they are not kidding about the NANO though, these blocks were TINY. However, there are a few extra pieces included in case one gets lost. The instructions are all in Japanese, as a heads up, but there are pictures accompanying them.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that I ordered Nanoblocks and received iBlock Fun.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Banks

customer_reviews.title: Fun, as pictured
customer_reviews.text: kids love the challenge of the extra tiny pieces. great for all ages of kids that like lego type toys. My 6 year old found it relatively easy to assemble, while my 12 year old had less patience and wanted help... so it depends on the kid. Love the variety of characters available.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Miller

customer_reviews.title: Charmander Lego Set
customer_reviews.text: Really cool once put together, however, very hard to put together! I had to re do some steps and take them apart a couple times (which is a pain in the neck to take apart). I do not recommend for kids 12 and under. The pieces are VERY small. The instructions are kinda hard to read. All in all though a fun little project.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Cute and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: It was super cute and exactly what I assumed it would be! Because it’s not real legos sometimes they don’t fit very well, and the pieces are very small, so it’s a bit difficult to build but it was very entertaining. I’m definitely buying other Pokémon for my collection
customer_reviews.author: Gabi_Vonborstel

customer_reviews.title: The Eeveelutions
customer_reviews.text: I bought Eevee and the Eeveelutions. They were fun to build and all so cute! My one complaint is that Vaporeon's ears come off easily when touched. Keep in mind that they are tiny when you finish assembling them.
customer_reviews.author: Hyun-Ae

customer_reviews.title: After the time spent building, the result is amazingly cute.
customer_reviews.text: This Snorlax give a little work to build. I would say that for a 8 yo kid is difficult, but for a 10yo kid it will be better. A nice thing is that the instructions are easy to follow, and also the product package shows the difficult. The product is very cute, and good to let in a desk as a decoration.
customer_reviews.author: Francine Rebello

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: Nephew was very pleased with this for his Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: The directions suck. But that’s why I like building nanoblocks, it can be challenging and takes awhile to complete. Also looks pretty cool on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended and very happy
customer_reviews.text: This Lapras was my first pokemon nanoblock purchase and I think I just found a new hobby! I read other reviews on Amazon about similar pokemon nanoblock products, so it is important to note: this is indeed the authentic Kawada brand, not a knock-off. Highly recommended and very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cute!
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these. They are fun to put together. This one is really cute!
customer_reviews.author: TStew

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Legos
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to Legos. Be aware that they are called Nanoblocks for a reason; therefore, they are very, very easy to lose. The instructions are pretty hard to follow, but I recommend going over the paper before attempting to start the build. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: drkndbrn

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Legos
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to Legos. Be aware that they are called Nanoblocks for a reason; therefore, they are very, very easy to lose. The instructions are pretty hard to follow, but I recommend going over the paper before attempting to start the build. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: drkndbrn

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Legos
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to Legos. Be aware that they are called Nanoblocks for a reason; therefore, they are very, very easy to lose. The instructions are pretty hard to follow, but I recommend going over the paper before attempting to start the build. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: drkndbrn

customer_reviews.title: Too Tiny
customer_reviews.text: The pieces are very tiny This should be stressed how tiny the pieces are. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M. Criss

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: Parts are much smaller than the picture looks like. Not worth the price. Very hard to put together, even for little hands.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Build Them All!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and frustrating all wrapped up into the best nano nerd toy ever!!! Blastois was my first nanoblock set to attempt, and now I want more!!! Was lots of fun and to rewarding. Shipping was super fast, arrived as shown and detailed on page, colors are bright and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with purchase. Pieces are small but overall patience was good so it was fun to build.
customer_reviews.author: Pearlssss

customer_reviews.title: Fun but challenging
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boyfriend who loves puzzles and Pokemon. He had a lot of fun putting it together and loved the challenge. I'd definitely get more for him since he enjoyed it so much!
customer_reviews.author: LauraC

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend, ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend, who loves puzzles, legos, and Pokemon nostalgia. they are not kidding about the NANO though, these blocks were TINY. However, there are a few extra pieces included in case one gets lost. The instructions are all in Japanese, as a heads up, but there are pictures accompanying them.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: he loved them. He did up three of them and ...
customer_reviews.text: Theses were for my grandson,s birthday. I wanted something other than the cards...he loved them. He did up three of them and allowed one of his sisters to make the other. Now he can start CA collection
customer_reviews.author: crackzorro11@hotmail com

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase! I bought this for my littler sister ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome purchase! I bought this for my littler sister for her birthday and she loved it. She's 18, and she said it took her about 30 minutes to assemble, although she said she probably could have finished faster if the blocks weren't so small. The assembled model has been sitting on her desk ever since, and it's been nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: book_thief

customer_reviews.title: Addictive
customer_reviews.text: I love them. Got myself a Mewtwo, Charizard and Blastoise. Charizard and Blastoise were a nice challenge. They’re al fun and they’re all addictive to finish
customer_reviews.author: Zyanya

customer_reviews.title: Instructions a bit confusing but manageable
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like charmander! A little tricky to put together End result I love it

customer_reviews.title: Great :)
customer_reviews.text: Another one for my collection. Delivery was faster than indicated, product is the original and was in excellent shape. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Margaux

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This was TEENY TINY. If I knew it was this small, I would of gotten regular legos at this price. Daughter liked it but she’s easy to please. I wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Wilmarthlinda

customer_reviews.title: He loved it--super cute and fun to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Gift for a friend. He loved it--super cute and fun to assemble. It was a bit smaller than I expected though.
customer_reviews.author: C.R.

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: Nano blocks are always fun! Great project and doesn’t take up a lot of space!
customer_reviews.author: dancinmoose

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I had fun building this together. The ears and tail fall of kind of easily, but we we're thinking of gluing together the pieces anyway because they're so small. Over all fun toy.

customer_reviews.text: This product is difficult for a child to assemble. The instruction are not clear

customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a Valentine's day gift, and it went over well with my Pokemon fan! It was also a lot of fun to put together!

product_meta.title: Nanoblock Pokemon Venusaur Building Kit, Blue
product_meta.description:
Color:VenusaurNanoblock. The original micro-sized building block. For the construction set fan seeking a superior building experience, nanoblock offers a greater challenge, sophistication and detail than any othr. Create exquisite 3D works of art with incredible realism and authenticity. Amazingly small bricks mere millimeters in size and manufactured to the highest tolerances for a secure fit, you can build display worthy sculptures that fit in the palm of your hand. Execute the finest details and build precise models with astounding results. Helps develop logical thinking, problem solving and fine motor skills. Each project comes with step by step instructions. Take your building experience to the next level with nanoblocks.

The Mini Collection series offers themed projects. Build replicas of common and exotic animals, favorite pets or intriguing insects. Celebrate your favorite hobby. Music lover? Build a guitar, drum set or grand piano. Explore rare marine life or travel back to the time of the dinosaurs. Learn about jungle inhabitants or the rare birds of the South American rainforest. Each model is amazingly detailed and realistic and is perfectly sized to be displayed on a desk or shelf.

The Sights to See series recreates world famous landmarks and architectural icons from all over the world. Travel to Paris to the Louvre, to Sydney and the Opera House, New York for the Empire State Building or ancient Greece for the Parthenon.

The Advanced Hobby Series provides the ultimate challenge. Recreate the historic Titanic on its transatlantic voyage; the White House or the Statue of Liberty. Travel to space in the Space Shuttle or back in time with a classic pirate ship. With thousands of individual pieces, you can create amazing results.

The smaller the brick, the better the build. 

Nanoblocks are designed by Kawada in Japan and brought to you by Schylling Toys, the world leader in traditional toys and classic fun.
feature_bullets: Build your favorite Pokemon character in astonishing detail with nanoblocks, the original micro-sized building block, collect all 13
Nanoblocks are a superior building experience with greater challenge, sophistication and detail than any other construction set
Build models with incredible detail, astounding Authenticity and unparalleled realism, results unmatched by other Block-Based systems
With bricks as small as 4mmx5mm and manufactured to the highest tolerances for a perfect fit, make amazing 3D art that fits in the palm of your hand
The smaller the brick the better the build; all sets come with detailed step by step instructions, for ages 8+

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,241 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
